    • Method Detail

      • destroyObject

        public void destroyObject()
        Destroy the object and clean up all associated resources. If this Signature object has been added to a document, do not call destroyObject() before the document has been saved or closed using the methods saveAs() or close() respectively.

      • getPageNo

        public int getPageNo()
        Get the page number where the signature is to be added to the document. If an invalid page number is set, it is added to the last page. Default: -1 (last page).

      • setPageNo

        public void setPageNo(int iPageNo)
        Set the page number where the signature is to be added to the document. If an invalid page number is set, it is added to the last page. Default: -1 (last page).

        Get the font size of the Text1 (title).

      • getLineWidth

        public float getLineWidth()
        Get the thickness of the line surrounding the visual signature.

      • setLineWidth

        public void setLineWidth(float fLineWidth)
        Set the thickness of the line surrounding the visual signature.

      • getRect

        public float[] getRect()
        Get the position and size of the digital signature annotation.

        Set or get the position and size of the digital signature annotation. The default is an invisible signature.
        The position is defined by the four values for the lower-left (x1, y1) and upper-right (x2, y2) corner of the rectangle. The units are PDF points (1 point = 1/72 inch, A4 = 595 x 842 points, Letter = 612 x 792 points) measured from the lower left corner of the page. If either the width or height is zero or negative, an invisible signature is created, i.e. no visible appearance is created for the signature.
        To create a signature in the lower left corner set the rectangle to [10, 10, 210, 60].

      • setRect

        public void setRect(float[] rect)
        Set the position and size of the digital signature annotation.

        Set or get the position and size of the digital signature annotation. The default is an invisible signature.
        The position is defined by the four values for the lower-left (x1, y1) and upper-right (x2, y2) corner of the rectangle. The units are PDF points (1 point = 1/72 inch, A4 = 595 x 842 points, Letter = 612 x 792 points) measured from the lower left corner of the page. If either the width or height is zero or negative, an invisible signature is created, i.e. no visible appearance is created for the signature.
        To create a signature in the lower left corner set the rectangle to [10, 10, 210, 60].

      • getStrokeColor

        public int getStrokeColor()
        Get the RGB value of the color of the signature's border line. In order to not set a color, i.e. keep it transparent, set setStrokeColor to –1.

      • setStrokeColor

        public void setStrokeColor(int iColor)
        Set the RGB value of the color of the signature's border line. In order to not set a color, i.e. keep it transparent, set setStrokeColor to –1.

      • getFillColor

        public int getFillColor()
        Get the RGB value of the color of the signature's background.

        In order to not set a color, i.e. keep the rectangle transparent, set the FillColor to –1.
        This is particularly useful in combination with adding an image to the signature.
        Default: 16761024 (red = 192, green = 192, blue = 255)

      • setFillColor

        public void setFillColor(int iColor)
        Set the RGB value of the color of the signature's background.

        In order to not set a color, i.e. keep the rectangle transparent, set the FillColor to –1.
        This is particularly useful in combination with adding an image to the signature.
        Default: 16761024 (red = 192, green = 192, blue = 255)

      • getImageFileName

        public java.lang.String getImageFileName()
        Get the path to an image file that is to be added to the signature.

      • setImageFileName

        public void setImageFileName(java.lang.String sFileName)
        Set the path to an image file that is to be added to the signature.
        The image is centered and scaled down proportionally to fit into the given rectangle. If the path is null, or the image does not exist, the appearance's background is a filled rectangle using the colors getFillColor and getStrokeColor. Note that for the output file to be PDF/A, the image's color space must match the document's output intent.
        If you want the appearance to contain the image only and no text, set the property setText2 to a space " ".

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Get the name of the certificate. The certificate must be available in the store.

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String sName)
        Set the name of the certificate. The certificate must be available in the store. In order to sign a PDF document, a valid, existing certificate name must be provided. The "Name" corresponds to the common name (CN) of the subject. In the Windows' certificate store this corresponds to "Issued to". When using a Windows OS, the certificate must be available in the Windows certificate store.
        This property can be used to select the signer certificate for signing.

      • getIssuer

        public java.lang.String getIssuer()
        Get the issuer of the certificate. The "Issuer" corresponds to the common name (CN) of the issuer. In the Windows' certificate store this corresponds to "Issued by".
        This property can be used to select the signer certificate for signing.

      • setIssuer

        public void setIssuer(java.lang.String sIssuer)
        Set the issuer of the certificate. The certificate must be available in the store. The "Issuer" corresponds to the common name (CN) of the issuer. In the Windows' certificate store this corresponds to "Issued by".
        This property can be used to select the signer certificate for signing.

      • getSerialNumber

        public java.lang.String getSerialNumber()
        Get the serial number of the certificate.
        This property is a hex string as displayed by the "Serial number" field in the Microsoft Management Console (MMC), e.g. "49 cf 7d d1 6c a9".
        This property can be used to select the signer certificate for signing.

      • setSerialNumber

        public void setSerialNumber(java.lang.String sSerialNumber)
        Set the serial number of the certificate. The certificate must be available in the store.
        This property is a hex string as displayed by the "Serial number" field in the Microsoft Management Console (MMC), e.g. "49 cf 7d d1 6c a9".
        This property can be used to select the signer certificate for signing.

      • getEmbedRevocationInfo

        public boolean getEmbedRevocationInfo()
        Get whether the OCSP responses or CRLs are embedded in the signature. See setEmbedRevocationInfo.

      • setEmbedRevocationInfo

        public void setEmbedRevocationInfo(boolean bEmbed)
        If true (and the certificate contains an OCSP server URL) then the OCSP responses or CRLs are embedded in the signature.
        Embed revocation information such as online certificate status response (OCSP - RFC 2560) and certificate revocation lists (CRL - RFC 3280).
        Revocation information of a certificate is either an OCSP response or a CRL, which is provided by a validation service at the time of signing and acts as proof that at the time of signing the certificate is valid. This is useful because even when the certificates expires or is revoked at a later time, the signature in the signed document remains valid.
        Embedding revocation information is optional but suggested when applying advanced or qualified electronic signatures. If the embedding is enabled then the information of the signer certificate and the issuer certificates other than the root certificate is embedded as well. This implies that both OCSP responses and CRLs can be present in the same message.
        The downsides of embedding revocation information are the increase of the file size (normally byaround 20k) and that it requires a connection to a validation service, which delays the process of signing (normally by around 2 seconds). For mass signing it is suggested to use the caching mechanism.
        Embedding revocation information requires an online connection to the CA that issues them. The firewall must be configured accordingly. In case a web proxy is used, it must be ensured the following MIME types are supported when using OCSP (not required for CRL):
        application/ocsp-request
        application/ocsp-response
        If setEmbedRevocationInfo is set to true, but the embedding failed, e.g. because the OCSP server is not reachable, the return value of convert is false, and the getErrorCode after convert is SIG_CREA_E_OCSP.
        Default: True.

      • getProvider

        public java.lang.String getProvider()
        Get the cryptographic provider used to create and verify signatures.

      • setProvider

        public void setProvider(java.lang.String sProvider)
        Set the cryptographic provider used to create and verify signatures.

        When using the Microsoft CryptoAPI Provider, the value of this property is to be set to a string with the following syntax: "[ProviderType:]Provider[;PIN]", e.g. "Microsoft Base Cryptographic Provider v1.0;123456" If the name of the provider is omitted, the default provider is used.

        When using the PKCS#11 Provider, the value of this property is to be set to a string with the following syntax: "PathToDll;SloId;Pin"

        When using any of the service providers, such as the Swisscom All-in signing service, the value of this property is essentially the url of the service endpoint: "http[s]://server.servicedomain.com:8080/url"

      • getStore

        public java.lang.String getStore()
        Get the name of the certificate store, e.g. MY, ROOT, CA (default: MY). For the Microsoft CryptoAPI Provider this defines the certificate store from where the signing certificate should be taken. This depends on the OS. Supported values are: MY, CA and ROOT.

      • setStore

        public void setStore(java.lang.String sStore)
        Set the name of the certificate store, e.g. MY, ROOT, CA (default: MY). For the Microsoft CryptoAPI Provider this defines the certificate store from where the signing certificate should be taken. This depends on the OS. Supported values are: MY, CA and ROOT.

      • getStoreLocation

        public int getStoreLocation()
        Get the location of the certificate store. For the Microsoft CryptoAPI Provider this defines the location of the certificate store from where the signing certificate should be taken. Supported are:
        0 Local Machine
        1 Current User (default)

      • setStoreLocation

        public void setStoreLocation(int iLocation)
        Set the location of the certificate store. For the Microsoft CryptoAPI Provider this defines the location of the certificate store from where the signing certificate should be taken. Supported are:
        0 Local Machine
        1 Current User (default)

      • getTimeStampURL

        public java.lang.String getTimeStampURL()
        Get the URL of the trusted Time-stamp authority (TSA) from which a Time-stamp shall be acquired, e.g. http://tsa.domain.com:8080/tsp

      • setTimeStampURL

        public void setTimeStampURL(java.lang.String sURL)
        Set the URL of the trusted Time-stamp authority (TSA) from which a Time-stamp shall be acquired, e.g. http://tsa.domain.com:8080/tsp
        This setting is suggested to be used when applying a Qualified Electronic Signature. Applying a Time-stamp requires an online connection to a time server; the firewall must be configured accordingly. In case a web proxy is used, it must be ensured the following MIME types are supported:
        application/timestamp-query
        application/timestamp-reply
        If an invalid Time-stamp server address is provided or no connection can be made to the time server, the return code of convert is false, and the property getErrorCode is set to SIG_CREA_E_TSP after calling convert.

      • getTimeStampCredentials

        public java.lang.String getTimeStampCredentials()
        Get the credentials of a time stamp server, e.g. username:password.

      • setTimeStampCredentials

        public void setTimeStampCredentials(java.lang.String sCredentials)
        Set the credentials of a time stamp server, e.g. username:password. If a Time-stamp server requires authentication, use this property to provide the credentials.

      • getReason

        public java.lang.String getReason()
        Get the descriptive text explaining why the digital signature was added. This is not required in order to create a valid signature. If this property is set to an empty string, no entry is created.

      • setReason

        public void setReason(java.lang.String sReason)
        Set the descriptive text explaining why the digital signature was added. This is not required in order to create a valid signature. If this property is set to an empty string, no entry is created.

      • getContactInfo

        public java.lang.String getContactInfo()
        Get the information provided by the signer to enable a recipient to contact the signer to verify the signature, e.g. a phone number. This is not required in order to create a valid signature. If this property is set to an empty string, no entry is created.

      • setContactInfo

        public void setContactInfo(java.lang.String sContactInfo)
        Set the information provided by the signer to enable a recipient to contact the signer to verify the signature, e.g. a phone number. This is not required in order to create a valid signature. If this property is set to an empty string, no entry is created.

      • getLocation

        public java.lang.String getLocation()
        Get the physical location where the signature was added, e.g. 'Zurich, Switzerland'. If this property is set to an empty string, no entry is created.

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(java.lang.String sLocation)
        Set the physical location where the signature was added, e.g. 'Zurich, Switzerland'. If this property is set to an empty string, no entry is created.

      • getFontName1

        public java.lang.String getFontName1()
        Get the path to the font name used in upper text, i.e. the text that is set by the property Text1.

      • setFontName1

        public void setFontName1(java.lang.String sFontName)
        Set the path to the font name used in upper text, i.e. the text that is set by the property Text1. Setting this property is optional.

      • getFontName2

        public java.lang.String getFontName2()
        Get the path to the font name used in lower text, i.e. the text that is set by the property Text2.

      • setFontName2

        public void setFontName2(java.lang.String sFontName)
        Set the path to the font name used in lower text, i.e. the text that is set by the property Text2. Setting this property is optional.

      • setFont1Mem

        public void setFont1Mem(byte[] font)
        Set the font used in upper text (see setFontName1) by passing the font as a memory buffer.

      • setFont2Mem

        public void setFont2Mem(byte[] font)
        Set the font used in lower text (see setFontName2) by passing the font as a memory buffer.

      • getText1

        public java.lang.String getText1()
        Get the upper text line of the visible signature.

      • setText1

        public void setText1(java.lang.String sText)
        Set the upper text line of the visible signature. If blank, signature name is added to the upper text line of the visual signature. In order to position text use the following syntax: <tab><x>,<y><delimiter><text> where tab is a tabulator, x and y are integers, delimiter means a single character such as a space and text is any text string not containing a tab.

      • getText2

        public java.lang.String getText2()
        Get the lower text line of the visible signature.

      • setText2

        public void setText2(java.lang.String sText)
        Set the lower text line of the visible signature. The text can be multi-lined by using linefeed ('0\n', 0xA).
        If blank, a text three-line text is constructed that consists of:
        - Statement who applied to signature
        - Reason
        - Date
        If you want the appearance to not contain any text, set this property to a space " ".

      • getSubFilter

        public java.lang.String getSubFilter()
        Get the name of the sub filter, such as "adbe.pkcs7.detached", "ETSI.CAdES.detached", or "ETSI.RFC3161".

      • setSubFilter

        public void setSubFilter(java.lang.String subFilter)
        Set the name of the sub filter, such as "adbe.pkcs7.detached", "ETSI.CAdES.detached", or "ETSI.RFC3161".

      • getSignerFingerprint

        public byte[] getSignerFingerprint()
        Get the sha1 fingerprint of the signer certificate. After validating a signature, this property contains the validated signature's fingerprint.

      • setSignerFingerprint

        public void setSignerFingerprint(byte[] data)
        Set the sha1 fingerprint of the signer certificate. This property can be used to select the signer certificate for signing.

      • getSignerFingerprintStr

        public java.lang.String getSignerFingerprintStr()
        Get the hex string representation of the signer certificate's sha1 fingerprint. In the Microsoft Management Console, the "Thumbprint" value can be used without conversion, if the "Thumbprint algorithm" is "sha1". E.g. b5 e4 5c 98 5a 7e 05 ff f4 c6 a3 45 13 48 0b c6 9d e4 5d f5.

      • setSignerFingerprintStr

        public void setSignerFingerprintStr(java.lang.String hexString)
        Set the hex string representation of the signer certificate's sha1 fingerprint. This property can be used to select the signer certificate for signing. All characters outside the ranges 0-9, a-f and A-F are ignored. In the Microsoft Management Console, the "Thumbprint" value can be used without conversion, if the "Thumbprint algorithm" is "sha1". E.g. b5 e4 5c 98 5a 7e 05 ff f4 c6 a3 45 13 48 0b c6 9d e4 5d f5.
